ygData.subject: A Trumpeter Swan In Africa..

    OOC:

    Hello. ^-^;  I just joined this RPG, and the following post is based on 
what I gathered from various posts received.  Corrections and/or some detail 
anyone would care to provide is fine.  On AOL or AIM you can send messages to 
PaperDragonz or Volvagiia.  On ICQ, look up the nickname "Faux Draconia" and 
you'll find me.  Thanks, and enjoy the post written on a Saturday morning on 
a sugar high. ^.~;;;;  Anyone can feel free to er...join in. o.o

    - Katriana (Kat) ,,,>^..^<,,,~*

    IC:

    The creature's supple neck arced downward, pristine blue eyes surveying 
the war torn landscape.  From her perspective, it was all color and texture, 
partially hidden from view by the many veils of clouds.  But the ebony pools 
within their aqua casings enlarged, and all became clear.  The metallic shine 
of robots and faux beasts of the land and lower atmospheres winked up at her, 
and each flare of crimson and orange near the ground was observed and taken 
into record.  

    Considerable attention was also payed to the titanic inert mass that was 
the center of the world at the time.  From here, it did not seem so grand, 
nor important.  And yet tiny creatures around it were scuffling about like 
ants for possession.  Or was there some other purpose...?  For such musings 
she would have to be closer, and learn more of those many scrambling robots 
below.  

    "Starting to get pretty bored with this flighty-lighty cloudland crud 
anyway.." 

    Metal pinions swept back, changing their angle and that of their owner.  
For a moment there was the image of a white shape curling gracefully through 
the air above a sea of clouds.  Then she dived into that deep misty sea.  
Trails of water vapor accompanied her as she left the high heavens 
altogether, twirling around her wings and neck.  Silently, the avian glided 
down from the sky, taking up a perch on a rock outcrop not particularly far 
from the battle.  Folding her wings, she gazed across the grassy plain, 
observing the world from this new perspective.  Perhaps things anew would be 
seen, as such happens often when you look at things from a di--  "It is HOT 
out here."  Or not.

    From here she spotted another large mass, but unlike the first this one 
was moving.  And it was under attack.  'Whee, destruction!' the bird mused to 
herself, settling back on the rock.  'Whichever ones win...I suppose I'll 
have a chat with them.'  Sky blue oculars half closed as the equivilant of a 
grin darted across that ebony beak.  She waited.
    
    And waited.

    A tumbleweed bounced on by.

    A bug crawled across her foot.

    "....."

    Her wing itched.

    "FINE then.  TAKE your time.  MAKE me come over there."  The bird 
announced to nobody, climbing back onto her webbed feet.  She spread her 
wings out as if to take flight, but instead she...changed.  In an instant her 
structure was far more humanoid, a slim and short robot with brilliant white 
armor, glints of black visible underneath at her joints, and across her 
middle.  Around her waist was a belt complete with a holster for what was 
apparently her only offensive weapon, a strange streamlined gun.  One hand 
reached down and took ahold of it, pushing a small button on the side.  The 
weapon's charge meter slowly began filling up.
    
    The gun was drawn and she flexed her wings, still present though 
modified.  A pair of boosters had been added in the transformation.  A simple 
helmet with two crests at the top surrounded a pale face, with eternally 
azure eyes targeting the combatants in the distance.  The semi-loud roar of 
the boosters on her wings echoed across the land and she took off, soaring 
rapidly toward the fighting.  

    - The Mysterious Trumpeter Swan 'Bot ( :P )
